title: 103_s551
content: SEC. 1. REFERENCES TO SOCIAL SECURITY ACT. Amendments in this Act refer to the Social Security Act. SEC. 2. DEFINITION OF FUNCTIONALLY DISABLED ELDERLY INDIVIDUAL. Section 1929(b)(1)(C) (42 U.S.C. 1396t(b)(1)(C)) is amended to allow individuals receiving supplemental security income benefits under title XVI or with income not exceeding three times the maximum amount for the supplementary security income program. The maximum income limit for individuals to qualify for benefits under the supplementary security income program is three times the maximum amount allowed. SEC. 3. DETERMINATIONS OF FUNCTIONAL DISABILITY. Section 1929(c)(1) (42 U.S.C. 1396t(c)(1)) is amended to increase the number of activities of daily living from 3 to 5, including bathing, dressing, toileting, transferring, and eating. Additionally, individuals needing substantial supervision due to cognitive or mental impairment are included. Individuals with cognitive or mental impairment may exhibit dangerous, disruptive, or difficult-to-manage behaviors. LIMITATION ON STATE PARTICIPATION IN PROGRAM. The amendment to Section 1929(m) includes new requirements for states to submit applications to provide home and community care under the program. The Secretary will develop criteria to review these applications and limit the number of participating states. The Secretary will select a maximum of 25 states to receive federal funding for home and community care. Amendments to Section 1929 include changes to criteria for state selection and participation in the program. Amendments to Section 1929 involve changes in criteria for state selection and participation in the program, including adjustments to subsections regarding state selection and home and community care provision. Amendments to Section 1929 involve changes in criteria for state selection and participation in the program, including adjustments to subsections regarding home and community care provision. The changes include specifying states selected to provide home and community care under this section in various subsections. SEC. 5 amends the limitation on the number of individuals eligible to participate in home and community care under Section 1929(m)(3). States can now limit the number of individuals served if funds are insufficient. SEC. 6 applies spousal impoverishment rules under Medicaid to spouses of individuals receiving home or community-based services. Section 1924(h)(1)(A) (42 U.S.C. 1396r-5(h)(1)(A)) is amended to include individuals in medical institutions or nursing facilities, or those described in section 1902(a)(10)(A)(ii)(VI). The amendments made by this Act will be effective on the date of enactment.
